techmeme.title: Filing: Hong Kong stock exchange executive Yang Qiumei received a 20% stake in SenseTime, worth $1.5B, from her late husband, making her its largest shareholder (Pui Gwen Yeung/Bloomberg)
A profile of the UK's Advanced Research and Invention Agency, set up in February 2022 with an £800M budget for high-risk, high-reward science and tech projects (Matt Reynolds/Wired)
Telegram CEO Pavel Durov says his previous post on ToS updates "may have seemed to announce a major shift in how Telegram works" but "little has changed" (Jake Rudnitsky/Bloomberg)
Meta rolls out its Fraud Intelligence Reciprocal Exchange to let UK banks share transaction intelligence to help catch scammers, after a pilot with two banks (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
Microsoft releases a $150 standalone version of Office 2024 for consumers and SMBs, with core app updates and UI changes; the last standalone was Office 2021 (Tom Warren/The Verge)
